|rad2chip2 = Marvell;88W8063;v48; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad2n = 450 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "48RGWM04.0GA" and "Manufactured for CISCO" are silkscreened on the board. :[[Wistron NeWeb]] is the OEM. The same hardware appears to be used with the later model [[Linksys EA4500]]. :[http://certifications.wi-fi.org/pdf_certificate.php?cid=WFA12602 Wi-Fi Certified] ==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31651-cisco-linksys-e4200v2-dual-band-n900-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] (source for this page) ===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=652649 On the ''DD-WRT'' forums] :The serial number for these devices may start with :[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=148893 ''01C106''], [http://homecommunity.cisco.com/t5/Wireless-Routers/How-to-determine-E4200-V1-or-V2/td-p/481308/page/2''01C116''], [http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Linksys_routers&action=historysubmit&diff=494570129&oldid=487275551 ''01C136'']. ===Blogs=== *[http://techhappens.blog.com/2012/10/26/making-the-ciscolinksys-e4200v2-work-for-you/ ''Making the Cisco/Linksys E4200v2'' work for you] *[http://bramp.net/blog/2012/01/obtaining-the-firmware-for-linksys-e4200v2/ ''Obtaining the firmware for Linksys E4200v2''] :[http://bramp.net/blog/2012/01/hacking-linksys-e4200v2-firmware/ ''Hacking Linksys E4200v2 firmware''] (binwalk dump) ===Firmware=== *[http://www.wolfteck.com/projects/candyhouse/ ''Hacking the Linksys E4200v2''] :(based on and extending work from the following) :[http://www.wolfteck.com/projects/candyhouse/install/ ''Installing Debian on the Linksys E4200v2''] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/linksys/linksys_e4200_v2 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/linksys/ea4500 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=51208 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = kirkwood |subtarget = generic |arch = arm_xscale |support_started_version = 15.05 |current_supported_version = 23.05.3 |unsupportedfuncntions = WPA3 |comment = 3x3, no DFS support }} Please insert instructions here ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The serial port is marked as J5 on the board. There are 6 pads in a row.
If you take pin 1 to be the square pad, you will find the following pinout: P1 - ? P2 - ? P3 - RX P4 - ? P5 - TX P6 - GND ==Pictures==
